intro: Baccharidastrum triplinervium, commonly known as the three-veined baccharis, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with lance-shaped leaves that have three distinct veins. Its flowers are small and clustered, often arranged in dense, spherical inflorescences. It is adapted to coastal and sandy environments, showing some degree of salt tolerance.
